node.Title: Graph machine learning with missing node features
node.Description: This blog post discusses how feature propagation can be an efficient and scalable approach for handling missing features in graph machine learning applications.

node.Title: Data transfer in Manhattan using RocksDB
node.Description: In this blog post, we talk about a performance and stability problem we encountered while migrating Manhattan's storage engine to RocksDB and how we solved it.

node.Title: Next generation data insights using natural language queries
node.Description: In this blog, we share details about how we built an in-house product called Qurious, which allows our internal customers to get answers to their analytical queries through natural language questions.

node.Title: Introducing a new Swift package for Apache Thrift
node.Description: Twitter’s new Thrift library is an open-source, standalone, lightweight, data encoding library. In this blog, we share our library so iOS developers outside Twitter can start using Thrift data.

node.Title: Data Quality Automation at Twitter
node.Description: In this post, we share how Twitter implemented a Data Quality Platform that gave customers the ability to have automated data quality checks.

node.Title: Stability and scalability for search
node.Description: In this blog, we discuss how we power real-time search for Tweets, Users, Direct Messages and more using Elasticsearch.

node.Title: Measuring the impact of Twitter network latency with CausalImpact
node.Description: In this blog, we share how we adopted the CausalImpact package from Google on a Twitter edge network experiment to measure the impact of improving Twitter's latency on customer engagement and revenue.

node.Title: How Twitter uses rasdaemon for hardware reliability
node.Description: At Twitter, our on premise data centers contain hundreds of thousands of hardware servers and millions of server hardware components.

node.Title: Constraint Management for cluster operation safety and reliability at Twitter
node.Description: As any team and its infrastructure grows, the risk of an unplanned service outage and potential data loss will grow.

node.Title: The data platform cluster operator service for Hadoop cluster management
node.Description: As any team and its infrastructure grows, the risk of an unplanned service outage and potential data loss will grow.

node.Title: Twitter’s Blobstore Hardware Lifecycle Monitoring and Reporting Service
node.Description: At Twitter, our on premise data centers contain hundreds of thousands of hardware servers and millions of server hardware components.

node.Title: How we scaled Reads On the Twitter Users Database
node.Description: At Twitter, our on premise data centers contain hundreds of thousands of hardware servers and millions of server hardware components.

node.Title: Kerberizing Hadoop Clusters at Twitter
node.Description: At Twitter, our on premise data centers contain hundreds of thousands of hardware servers and millions of server hardware components.
